reviewText: This is a really good movie for the bike enthusiasts. I recommend this to everyone that loves motorcycles, and this was produced very well.Hope you enjoy as much as myself.If you like this you will absolutely love the Anthony Hopkins movie Fastest Indian.I Love That movie.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell

reviewText: The first of the 3 segments on this DVD I had previously viewed on TV. The 2nd and 3rd segment covered the informant that ratted on the Hells Angels during the Rock Machine/ HA war in Canada. The quality of the re-enactments and the depth of the reporting is very good. As usual the opinions of the producers is slanted towards making the police look as heroic as possible. If you like these documentary style programs then this is a good one to watch.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell

reviewText: Great multi disk biker CLUB documentry. I think it has too much law enforcement influence but it does cover most of the major clubs.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell

reviewText: The video is a good primer for those who want to learn the basics of outlaw motorcycle gangs, especially the number ones: Hell's Angels.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell

reviewText: I thought this video was interesting and informative although long. I enjoyed learning about the history of how the clubs got started and expanded all over the world. I didn't know that about them before I watched the videos. I would recommend this video to anyone who is curious about motorcycle biker clubs.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell

reviewText: What an eye opener to learn how corrupt the canadian chapter of Hell's angels were. This was a very informative video. It makes me glad they no longer exist.
Title: Outlaw Bikers: Raise Some Hell
